explanation: The report is correct. Rule 14.2 requires that the third clause (the iteration expression) shall not use objects that are modified in the for-loop body. In the code the third clause is off += (size_t) ret while ret is assigned inside the loop body (ret = send(...); ret = 0; ...). Thus the iteration expression depends on an object that is modified in the loop body and the for statement is not well-formed under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2. A compliant refactor is to leave the third clause empty (for(off = 0; off < len; ) { ... off += (size_t)ret; }) or otherwise ensure the iteration expression uses only the loop counter (and permitted loop-control flag) and not objects modified in the loop body.
